topic.title: Looking for the Owner of GitMirror
topic.body:
Looking to collab with the creator of [GitMirror](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Nv8Y4Luger3g3Q7rqwtQYJRbhQc6disDM/) if they are looking for hands.

homebrew@zeroid.bit

2_1M78zG4cdm2osFEpXApCHxh6bu936kgte6.body:
Going to start tracking projects and opportunity spaces here: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GWKbh1vtmccqQBZNaR3xBZ18WYVzxuD1z/ 

There seems to be a list of development project ideas on ZeroWiki as well: http://127.0.0.1:43110/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:dev-ideas

> [oxal](#comment_1_16HSZpQsJrnXJ6KwukKPAWpY3hTCEDigjx): Link has no peers. Is this your site?

Yup. I should be peered now. I have two seeds at the moment. Sadly neither is super reliable until I finish my travel.

6_17VwZEfWSUWb5RHkK9m1odnDdBfvjTL6Cp.body:
> [altair916](#comment_18_13WnNjGWpKx29MGErCCpUAnP772R3fYyMk): Lot of free as well as commercial Softwares are available in Windows and Mac

Sure, but the platform itself is inherently unfree.

1_15CqBbUc5MsPDdX37tK5xusN8QMKK4RnLY.body: Your LAN/WAN will be unaffected, but your endpoint won't be any faster, but slower.

> [klapamuda](#comment_2_15CqBbUc5MsPDdX37tK5xusN8QMKK4RnLY): so if want my network get benefit from zeronet (video stream) i need to turn off tor, is't? what i mean speed benefit (full lan speed) from same network. i want to share video or to say seed video for my network

I think I understand. If you want make sure that you're getting the best possible speed for local devices to both local and remote, you'd have to disable TOR. That comes with the caveat that you will unquestionably be more vulnerable and your privacy will not be assured.

1_1M5c4n1YevPV4Z3ZVS21BzH7b56qZhcML2.body: Get the fuck out of here with your hate.

1_12ECCQvpMwvrfnW7HPBJvvR4RA3STet2Ec.body: Get the fuck out of here with your hate.
